Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: One evening, my friend Alex was out for a jog in the park when something strange happened. As he was running near the pond, he stumbled upon an old, weathered box half-buried in the dirt. Curious, he decided to open it, revealing a collection of odd, antique trinkets. Among them was a faded photograph of a woman he didn’t recognize, holding a strange key. Just as he was about to leave, he heard a faint whisper from behind. Turning around, no one was there. Feeling unnerved, Alex left the park, but as he walked home, he noticed the photograph in his pocket. It wasn’t there before. At that moment, a chill ran down his spine. What had he gotten himself into? The next day, the box and the photograph were gone. All that remained was the key, now mysteriously tucked in his jacket. He had no idea what it meant, but it would haunt him forever. Correction: One evening, my friend Alex was out for a jog in the park when something strange happened. As he was running near the pond, he stumbled upon an old, weathered box half-buried in the dirt. Curious, he decided to open it, revealing a collection of odd, antique trinkets. Among them was a faded photograph of a woman he didn’t recognize, holding a strange key. Just as he was about to leave, he heard a faint whisper from behind. Turning around, no one was there. Feeling unnerved, Alex left the park, but as he walked home, he noticed the photograph in his pocket. It wasn’t there before. At that moment, a chill ran down his spine. What had he gotten himself into? The next day, the box and the photograph were gone. All that remained was the key, now mysteriously tucked in his jacket. He had no idea what it meant, but it would haunt him forever.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your company is changing its logo, and two managers are discussing how to explain the change. Listen to their conversation and write a formal email based on what you hear. Type in the input box. Write 120–150 words. Response: Dear customer, it gives us great pleasure to announce that we are changing our company logo. Our market research has shown that our old logo is very unfashioned and old school. As a result, we have decided that it's time to replace the old logo with a modern designed logo. In addition, by changing our logo, we can improve our reputation as a leader in the field. We hope and believe that this change will convince you just as much. However, please feel free to give us any opinion about the change. We look forward to welcoming you at our event on July 24th and introducing you to our new logo. Please confirm your participation by July 10th. Best regards, Team XYZ Correction: Dear customer, it gives us great pleasure to announce that we are changing our company logo. Our market research has shown that our old logo is very unfashioned and old school. As a result, we have decided that it's time to replace the old logo with a moderndesigned logo. In addition, by changing our logo, we can improve our reputation as a leader in the field. We hope and believe that this change will convince you just as much. However, please feel free to give us any opinion about the change. We look forward to welcoming you at our event on July 24th and introducing you to our new logo. Please confirm your participation by July 10th. Best regards, Team XYZ

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: You're going to write about an interesting, fictional event that happened to a friend. Write your blog post. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: A Strange Day at the Train Station Last month, something very interesting happened to my friend Riya. She was going to visit her aunt in another city and had to catch an early morning train. When she reached the station, she saw a small puppy sitting alone near the ticket counter. It looked scared and hungry. Riya loves animals, so she bought some biscuits and gave them to the puppy. Then, something surprising happened. The puppy started following her everywhere — even onto the train! The train guard saw this and smiled. He said, “Looks like you have a new travel partner!” Riya didn’t know what to do, but the other passengers were kind. They helped her take care of the puppy during the journey. When she reached her aunt’s house, she decided to keep the puppy and named him “Lucky.” Now, Lucky is a happy part of her family. That one small moment at the station changed both their lives. Correction: A Strange Day at the Train Station Last month, something very interesting happened to my friend Riya. She was going to visit her aunt in another city and had to catch an early morning train. When she reached the station, she saw a small puppy sitting alone near the ticket counter. It looked scared and hungry. Riya loves animals, so she bought some biscuits and gave them to the puppy. Then, something surprising happened. The puppy started following her everywhere — even onto the train! The train guard saw this and smiled. He said, “Looks like you have a new travel partner!” Riya didn’t know what to do, but the other passengers were kind. They helped her take care of the puppy during the journey. When she reached her aunt’s house, she decided to keep the puppy and named him “Lucky.” Now, Lucky is a happy part of her family. That one small moment at the station changed both their lives.

Prompt Level: 6.0 Prompt: Write about a company problem you are familiar with. Describe the problem. What possible solutions were there? Was a solution found? For reasons of confidentiality, do not mention a real company name, real people's names or real product names. Use general terms and descriptions instead. Type in the input box. Write 60-100 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: One company I know had a problem with poor communication between departments. Teams often worked on similar tasks without knowing, which caused confusion and wasted time. A possible solution was to introduce a shared project board and hold weekly update meetings. After trying this, communication improved. Team members started to share progress and ask questions more often. While not perfect, this method helped reduce repeated work and made the workflow smoother. Correction: One company I know had a problem with poor communication between departments. Teams often worked on similar tasks without knowing, which caused confusion and wasted time. A possible solution was to introduce a shared project board and hold weekly update meetings. After trying this, communication improved. Team members started to share progress and ask questions more often. While not perfect, this method helped reduce repeated work and made the workflow smoother.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: You work for an electronics company and are preparing a speech for a celebration dinner. Include a greeting/opening, a part where you show thanks, and a conclusion where you try to motivate the staff. Type in the input box. Write 125–200 words. Response: Ladies and gentlemen, esteemed colleagues, and valued guests,

Today, we gather not just to mark another milestone in our journey, but to celebrate the incredible achievements that each of you has contributed to our success.

Over the past year, we have faced challenges that tested our resolve, yet together, we turned those challenges into opportunities. Whether it was launching new projects, exceeding our targets, or supporting each other through difficult times, your dedication and hard work have truly shone.

I want to take a moment to recognize some key accomplishments. [Mention specific achievements or projects, highlighting team contributions and individual efforts.] Each of these milestones represents countless hours of commitment and teamwork.

As we celebrate today, let’s also look to the future. The road ahead is filled with exciting possibilities. With our talented team and innovative spirit, I have no doubt that we will continue to reach new heights. Let’s keep pushing boundaries, supporting one another, and fostering the creativity that drives our success.

Thank you all for your hard work, passion, and resilience. Each of you plays a vital role in our company’s story, and I am grateful to have such an amazing team by my side.

So, let’s raise our glasses to our collective achievements, to the friendships we’ve built, and to the exciting future that lies ahead. Here’s to us, to our success, and to many more celebrations to come!

Cheers! Correction: <input>Ladies and gentlemen, esteemed colleagues, and valued guests,

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Firstly, celebrities use social media and put out controversial content. The content they post gets a lot of attention due to the inappropriate message. They aren’t fake as human beings but as how they are presented to the world. Women and sometimes men whine about how they hate a part of their body or how ugly they are. Everyone wants something they don’t have. They look at celebrities as flawless human beings who have amazing features. What people always forget is that what they see on magazines or on TV is airbrushed and edited. There are many young girls who look up to the top models and actresses who are known for being very beautiful individuals. They wish to be like the celebrities they see on billboards. Celebrities are just as human as everyone else. They have imperfections and their bad features. But that side of them is concealed by all the Photoshop and airbrushing done to them. People look at these edited pictures and get inspired to look like them. Correction: Firstly, celebrities use social media and put out controversial content. The content they post gets a lot of attention due to the inappropriate message. They aren’t fake as human beings but as how they are presented to the world. Women and sometimes men whine about how they hate a part of their body or how ugly they are. Everyone wants something they don’t have. They look at celebrities as flawless human beings who have amazing features. What people always forget is that what they see on magazines or on TV is airbrushed and edited. There are many young girls who look up to the top models and actresses who are known for being very beautiful individuals. They wish to be like the celebrities they see on billboards. Celebrities are just as human as everyone else. They have imperfections and their bad features. But that side of them is concealed by all the Photoshop and airbrushing done to them. People look at these edited pictures and get inspired to look like them.

The plot is about 6 unsolved murders. The film’s soundtrack was composed by Thomas Newman. Set in the early 1990s in Los Angeles, the film is about two detectives investigating a series of murders, which lead them to a lonely stranger who may be the killer. The style of the film is called "Neo-noir" and is a style of cinema that uses much of the elements of film noir, but which deals with topics with current content, and in which aesthetically elements that were absent in film noir films of the 1940s and 1950s are observed. I spent a very good time. Correction: YesterdayI saw the film "The little things". A thriller directed by Hancock. Denzel Washington and Rami Malek are the main actors. The plot is about 6 unsolved murders. The film’s soundtrack was composed by Thomas Newman. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: As there were a few problems with Cessna 123's landing, you have been asked to write a report by your superiors. Write the report below. Write 100 - 150 words. Response: On June 15, 2025, Cessna 123 experienced minor complications during its landing at Springfield Regional Airport. During final approach, the aircraft encountered unexpected crosswind gusts up to 18 knots, which affected alignment with Runway 27. The aircraft made a hard landing, resulting in a bounce and a brief veer to the left before the pilot regained full control. No injuries were reported, and the aircraft taxied safely to the gate. Preliminary checks suggest possible minor issues with the nose gear shock absorption system. Weather conditions were within operational limits, but the gusts were stronger than forecasted. The flight crew followed standard procedures and responded promptly to the situation. The aircraft has been temporarily grounded for a full inspection. Further investigation is underway to determine whether any mechanical or procedural factors contributed to the incident. Recommendations will be issued following the maintenance report. Correction: On June 15, 2025, Cessna 123 experienced minor complications during its landing at Springfield Regional Airport. During final approach, the aircraft encountered unexpected crosswind gusts up to 18 knots, which affected alignment with Runway 27. The aircraft made a hard landing, resulting in a bounce and a brief veer to the left before the pilot regained full control. No injuries were reported, and the aircraft taxied safely to the gate. Preliminary checks suggest possible minor issues with the nose gear shock absorption system. Weather conditions were within operational limits, but the gusts were stronger than forecasted. The flight crew followed standard procedures and responded promptly to the situation. The aircraft has been temporarily grounded for a full inspection. Further investigation is underway to determine whether any mechanical or procedural factors contributed to the incident. Recommendations will be issued following the maintenance report.

Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: I remember when I was in high school, more precisely in technical school, my teacher told the class that, for professional life, it is very important to buy a newspaper and read it to stay up to date with the news, because in an interview, we need to be prepared. That is still engraved in my mind. I liked to read printed newspapers on sunday morning. I used to announce on this journal. But, today, all is digital. Nowadays, all the news is in our hands, on a cell phone or tablet, at any time, anywhere. Nowadays, printed newspapers are a rarity, it´s becoming extinct. About this, I think it's not so good for us humans, because we were not made for this speed. We need more time to absorb information and live better. Nowadays it is not uncommon for the medical center to be so crowded with people with mental disorders. So give yourself time, slow down. Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language students often encounter a variety of issues and challenges that can impede their learning process. What are the most common difficulties they face, and how can these be addressed?

Firstly, language learners frequently struggle with pronunciation and accents. The phonetic differences between their native language and the target language can lead to misunderstandings and communication barriers. This challenge can be mitigated through practice and exposure to native speakers, as well as utilizing language learning tools that focus on pronunciation.

Another significant issue is the complexity of grammar and syntax. Language students often find it difficult to grasp the rules and structures of a new language, which can be vastly different from their own. To overcome this, learners can benefit from structured lessons and exercises that incrementally build their understanding, alongside practical application in conversations and writing.

Vocabulary acquisition is also a hurdle, as memorizing and retaining new words can be overwhelming. Students can address this challenge by using mnemonic devices, engaging in immersive experiences, and employing spaced repetition techniques to reinforce memory.

Additionally, cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions pose challenges, as language is deeply intertwined with culture. Students may struggle to understand context or use language appropriately. Exposure to authentic materials such as films, books, and interactions with native speakers can help bridge this gap.

Finally, motivation and confidence are crucial yet fragile elements. Language learning is a long-term commitment that requires perseverance. Encouragement from peers, setting achievable goals, and celebrating small victories can sustain motivation and boost confidence.

In summary, language students face numerous challenges, but with strategic approaches and consistent effort, these obstacles can be overcome, leading to successful language acquisition. Correction: <input>Language students often encounter a variety of issues and challenges that can impede their learning process. What are the most common difficulties they face, and how can these be addressed?

Firstly, language learners frequently struggle with pronunciation and accents. The phonetic differences between their native language and the target language can lead to misunderstandings and communication barriers. This challenge can be mitigated through practice and exposure to native speakers, as well as utilizing language learning tools that focus on pronunciation.

Another significant issue is the complexity of grammar and syntax. Language students often find it difficult to grasp the rules and structures of a new language, which can be vastly different from their own. To overcome this, learners can benefit from structured lessons and exercises that incrementally build their understanding, alongside practical application in conversations and writing.

Vocabulary acquisition is also a hurdle, as memorizing and retaining new words can be overwhelming. Students can address this challenge by using mnemonic devices, engaging in immersive experiences, and employing spaced repetition techniques to reinforce memory.

Additionally, cultural nuances and idiomatic expressions pose challenges, as language is deeply intertwined with culture. Students may struggle to understand context or use language appropriately. Exposure to authentic materials such as films, books, and interactions with native speakers can help bridge this gap.

Finally, motivation and confidence are crucial yet fragile elements. Language learning is a long-term commitment that requires perseverance. Encouragement from peers, setting achievable goals, and celebrating small victories can sustain motivation and boost confidence.

In summary, language students face numerous challenges, but with strategic approaches and consistent effort, these obstacles can be overcome, leading to successful language acquisition.</input>

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Many people find it difficult to start a writing project. They may have difficulty thinking about what to write, so they procrastinate. But everything usually generates more stress and anxiety as the deadline approaches, which in turn can make it even more difficult to start a paper. There are different techniques, but in my opinion, listening and freewriting are the most effective when you need to tell a story. Listening, talking to other people about your topic and listening to their comments; you will probably learn a new perspective on your topic that you hadn't imagined. If you are making an argument, share it with others; what objections do they raise? If you are researching a social issue, interview others and ask their opinion about it. Freewriting, to overcome anxiety or blockage, force yourself to write about the topic for five to ten minutes without stopping. If you get stuck and don't know what to say, simply write “I don't know what to say...”. Keep writing and don't stop until the time is up. Remember that freewriting is for your eyes only, so there is no pressure to “get it right.” After five or ten minutes, stop writing. Read what you have written. The important thing is to find the technique that helps you the most, Correction: Many people find it difficult to start a writing project. They may have difficulty thinking about what to write, so they procrastinate. But everything usually generates more stress and anxiety as the deadline approaches, which in turn can make it even more difficult to start a paper. There are different techniques, but in my opinion, listening and freewriting are the most effective when you need to tell a story. Listening, talking to other people about your topicand listening to their comments; you will probably learn a new perspective on your topic that you hadn't imagined. If you are making an argument, share it with others; what objections do they raise? If you are researching a social issue, interview others and ask their opinion about it. Freewriting, to overcome anxiety or blockage, force yourself to write about the topic for five to ten minutes without stopping. If you get stuck and don't know what to say, simply write “I don't know what to say...”. Keep writing and don't stop until the time is up. Remember that freewriting is for your eyes only, so there is no pressure to “get it right.” After five or ten minutes, stop writing. Read what you have written. The important thing is to find the technique that helps you the most,

Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Apply the language you've learned in this lesson to a new topic: language learning. Write about issues and challenges that language students often face. Ask yourself guiding questions to help organize the writing. Type in the input box. Write 150-250 words. Response: Language learning is a rewarding but often challenging journey. Students frequently face difficulties that range from pronunciation struggles to mastering grammar and vocabulary retention. One common issue is overcoming the fear of making mistakes. Many learners hesitate to speak because they worry about errors, which can hinder their progress. Confidence-building exercises, such as practicing with native speakers or engaging in conversations, help students gain fluency. Another challenge is understanding cultural nuances. Language is deeply tied to culture, and learners may struggle with idioms, slang, or expressions that don’t directly translate. Exposure to authentic materials, such as movies, books, and conversations, enhances cultural comprehension. Additionally, memorizing vocabulary and grammar rules can be daunting. Rote learning often fails to stick, so students benefit from active learning techniques, such as writing practice, using words in context, and spaced repetition systems. Consistency is also crucial—many learners start with enthusiasm but struggle with maintaining a regular study schedule. Setting achievable goals and incorporating language learning into daily routines can help sustain progress. By addressing these challenges with patience and persistence, students can improve their proficiency and enjoy the process of mastering a new language. Would you like suggestions on effective study strategies? Correction: Language learning is a rewarding but often challenging journey. Many learners hesitate to speak because they worry about errors, which can hinder their progress. Confidence-building exercises, such as practicing with native speakers or engaging in conversations, help students gain fluency. Another challenge is understanding cultural nuances. Exposure to authentic materials, such as movies, books, and conversations, enhances cultural comprehension. Additionally, memorizing vocabulary and grammar rules can be daunting. Rote learning often fails to stick, so students benefit from active learning techniques, such as writing practice, using words in context, and spaced repetition systems. Consistency is also crucial—many learners start with enthusiasm but struggle with maintaining a regular study schedule. Prompt Level: 15.0 Prompt: Write a comparison-contrast essay about your favorite city and another place. Use the 'X then Y' structure. Be sure to polish your work before you submit it. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: **Mumbai, Then Udaipur: A Tale of Two Cities** Mumbai, a bustling metropolis on India's western coast, is a city that never sleeps. Its energetic pace, towering skyline, and vibrant street life define its identity. The local trains, crowded markets, and late-night food stalls all contribute to its charm. Mumbai is also a cultural melting pot—home to Bollywood, diverse communities, and a rhythm that pulses through every lane. Then there's Udaipur, nestled in the hills of Rajasthan, where time slows and elegance takes center stage. Known as the “City of Lakes,” Udaipur offers tranquility with its calm waters, whitewashed palaces, and narrow alleyways. It’s a place for reflection, rich in history and artistic heritage. The air feels lighter, the horizon broader, and the sunsets deeper. While Mumbai thrives on speed, Udaipur flourishes in serenity. One thrives in modernity, the other glows with tradition. Together, they reveal the incredible diversity within India—one city rushing toward tomorrow, the other preserving yesterday. And in the contrast between them, you find not a conflict but a balance. Response: Corporate Social Responsibility: A Necessary Balance I believe that companies do have a responsibility to society, not just to their shareholders. While it’s true that businesses exist to generate profit, their operations are deeply intertwined with the communities and environments in which they function. Ignoring this connection not only damages a company’s public image but can also hurt long-term profitability. Companies benefit from public infrastructure, legal protections, and the labor of local populations. In return, they should contribute positively to society. This could be through sustainable practices, fair wages, ethical sourcing, and community investment. As lil@213 pointed out, it’s a two-way street—businesses operate in spaces granted by society, and they should give back in ways that ensure mutual benefit. Moreover, CSR isn’t just about doing the right thing; it’s smart business. As Jack@MSU mentioned, consumers today are more aware and concerned about how companies behave. A strong CSR strategy can build brand loyalty and attract talent, which ultimately supports the bottom line. That said, I agree with patty925 to some extent—governments should set the rules. But companies can and should go beyond just meeting the bare minimum. Responsibility shouldn’t end where legality begins. In conclusion, corporate social responsibility isn’t a distraction from profit—it’s a way to ensure sustainable success for businesses and the societies they depend on. Companies should consider their impact on these areas and contribute to their well-being.

Corporate social responsibility (CSR) can lead to long-term benefits for companies. For example, by adopting sustainable business practices, companies can protect resources for the future while also reducing their carbon footprint. Providing fair wages and good working conditions for employees can lead to higher job satisfaction, lower turnover, and greater productivity. This is not only beneficial for the company but also for the individuals and families it supports.

Additionally, consumers are increasingly aware of companies’ social and environmental impacts. They are more likely to support businesses that demonstrate ethical behavior and contribute positively to society. A strong CSR program can help build trust and loyalty among customers, which ultimately helps the company’s bottom line.

In conclusion, CSR is not just about charity or public image. It’s a smart and ethical business practice that benefits both the company and the society in which it operates. This report outlines the observed problems and provides recommendations for improvement. As it follows, the main observations are concerning the approaching angle of the Cessna 123 as it approached the runway at a steeper angle than recommended, resulting in a hard touchdown. As to the flare timing, the pilot initiated the flare too late, causing the aircraft to touch down abruptly and finally, as far as the crosswind handling is concerned, Cessna 123 struggled to maintain alignment with the runway during crosswind conditions. Some Recommendations: As to timing, we suggest that the pilot should undergo additional training on proper approach and flare techniques. Concerning crosswind training we suggest that the specific crosswind landing training is essential to improve handling during adverse conditions. In respect to the review SOPs, we suggest that it is ensured adherence to standard operating procedures (SOPs) for safe landings. In conclusion, addressing these issues will enhance safety and prevent similar incidents in the future. Regular training and adherence to procedures are critical for all pilots. Thank you for your attention to this matter. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Criticizing celebrities or the concept of celebrity culture can be a delicate task. Here’s a general critique of the idea of celebrity:

The phenomenon of celebrity culture often glorifies individuals for superficial reasons, such as their appearance or social media presence, rather than their genuine contributions to society. This can lead to a distorted sense of values, where fame and wealth are prioritized over integrity and hard work. Celebrities are frequently placed on pedestals, creating unrealistic standards that can negatively impact the self-esteem of their followers. Moreover, the constant scrutiny and invasion of privacy that celebrities endure can be detrimental to their mental health, highlighting the toxic nature of fame. The media’s obsession with celebrities also diverts attention from more pressing global issues, such as climate change and social justice, which deserve greater focus and action. In essence, while the allure of celebrity can be captivating, it often promotes a culture that is shallow and disconnected from the realities and challenges faced by everyday people. Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: A website has invited you to write your opinion on the topic of corporate social responsibility. Read the postings before you begin. Remember the structure you've learned on how to construct an argument. Write 200-250 words. Response: In Support of Corporate Social Responsibility

In the contemporary global economy, corporations are not isolated entities operating solely for profit; they are integral components of the societies in which they function. As such, they bear a responsibility that extends beyond the interests of shareholders. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) represents a strategic and ethical commitment to sustainable development, social equity, and environmental stewardship.

Engaging in CSR initiatives allows companies to foster trust and credibility among stakeholders, including customers, employees, and the broader community. By supporting educational programs, environmental conservation, and fair labor practices, corporations contribute to the long-term well-being of the societies that enable their success. These actions are not merely philanthropic—they are investments in a stable and prosperous operating environment.

Furthermore, CSR enhances employee morale and retention, as individuals increasingly seek to work for organizations that reflect their personal values. Consumers, too, are more inclined to support brands that demonstrate genuine social and environmental concern. In this sense, CSR is not only ethically sound but also economically advantageous.

While some critics argue that CSR is a superficial marketing strategy, its tangible benefits to both society and business performance are well-documented. Ultimately, responsible corporate behavior is essential for building resilient communities and ensuring sustainable economic growth. Correction: <input>In Support of Corporate Social Responsibility

In the contemporary global economy, corporations are not isolated entities operating solely for profit; they are integral components of the societies in which they function. As such, they bear a responsibility that extends beyond the interests of shareholders. Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) represents a strategic and ethical commitment to sustainable development, social equity, and environmental stewardship.

Engaging in CSR initiatives allows companies to foster trust and credibility among stakeholders, including customers, employees, and the broader community. By supporting educational programs, environmental conservation, and fair labor practices, corporations contribute to the long-term well-being of the societies that enable their success. These actions are not merely philanthropic—they are investments in a stable and prosperous operating environment.

Furthermore, CSR enhances employee morale and retention, as individuals increasingly seek to work for organizations that reflect their personal values. Consumers, too, are more inclined to support brands that demonstrate genuine social and environmental concern. In this sense, CSR is not only ethically sound but also economically advantageous.

While some critics argue that CSR is a superficial marketing strategy, its tangible benefits to both society and business performance are well-documented. Ultimately, responsible corporate behavior is essential for building resilient communities and ensuring sustainable economic growth.</input>

Located in the northeastern hills, Shillong offers a serene environment with lush green hills, waterfalls, and a tranquil atmosphere, making it ideal for nature lovers and those seeking peace away from urban chaos. Bangalore, on the other hand, is the capital of Karnataka and is renowned for its thriving tech industry and cosmopolitan vibe. Located in the southern part of India, it has a moderate climate, with a mix of urban development and green spaces. Known as the "Silicon Valley of India," Bangalore is a hub for innovation and IT professionals, making it a bustling and fast-paced city. It also boasts a lively cultural scene, with numerous restaurants, cafes, and vibrant nightlife. While Shillong offers a calm and natural retreat, Bangalore is an energetic city full of opportunities, making it the ideal choice for career-driven individuals. Both cities hold their charm, but they cater to different lifestyles: Shillong for those seeking tranquility, and Bangalore for those embracing a modern, urban life. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: Buying a home in my country, which is Spain, can be both exciting and challenging, especially when applying for a home loan. The process itself can be relatively straightforward, but it involves a lot of paperwork and attention to detail. First, one must choose the property, and then apply for a mortgage, which often requires submitting proof of income, tax returns, and details of your financial situation. Also, in Spain it is mandatory to sign the purchase before Notary Public, who can be helpful when it comes to understand all this paperwork. The forms involved in the process can be numerous, depending on the bank or financial institution. Most banks require a full set of documents, including identification, proof of employment, and details of any other loans. The amount of paperwork might seem overwhelming, but with a good understanding of the requirements, it is manageable. In terms of cost, housing in Spain can be quite expensive, especially in larger cities like Madrid or Barcelona, where prices have been rising in recent years. Mortgage rates in Spain are generally low, but they can vary depending on the bank and the applicant's financial situation. Regarding the use of professionals, it is common to employ a real estate agent to help with the property search. In general terms, it may not be easy to purchase a house in Spain, but it is worthy! Correction: Buying a home in my country, which is Spain, can be both exciting and challenging, especially when applying for a home loan. First, one must choose the property, and then apply for a mortgage, which often requires submitting proof of income, tax returns, and details of your financial situation. Mortgage rates in Spain are generally low, but they can vary depending on the bank and the applicant's financial situation. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: In the preceding units, nine writing techniques were introduced: metaphor, hyperbole, symbolism, free writing, focused free writing, loop writing, listing, questioning and cubing. Write a paragraph or two explaining which techniques seem most useful to you. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Among the nine writing techniques introduced, I find **metaphor** and **focused free writing** to be the most useful. Metaphors allow me to convey complex ideas and emotions in a relatable and vivid manner. By comparing one thing to another, metaphors create strong imagery and help readers understand abstract concepts more easily. For instance, describing a challenging situation as "climbing a mountain" instantly evokes the effort and perseverance required. This technique enriches my writing by adding depth and resonance, making it more engaging for the reader. On the other hand, focused free writing is invaluable for generating ideas and overcoming writer's block. By setting a specific topic and writing continuously without worrying about grammar or structure, I can explore my thoughts freely and uncover new perspectives. This technique helps in organizing my ideas and often leads to unexpected insights that can be refined later. Focused free writing allows me to delve deeply into a subject, uncovering layers of meaning and connections that might not be immediately apparent. Combining these techniques, I can create engaging and thought-provoking content while maintaining a clear and coherent structure. This blend of creativity and organization is essential for producing high-quality writing that resonates with readers. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The concept of celebrity often perpetuates an unhealthy obsession with wealth, beauty, and status, overshadowing more meaningful contributions to society. For example, many celebrities are criticized for their excessive lifestyles, flaunting their privilege while being disconnected from the struggles of everyday people. A glaring issue is the way some celebrities use their platforms irresponsibly, spreading misinformation or promoting harmful trends simply to remain relevant. This behavior not only undermines their influence but can also negatively impact their audience, particularly impressionable young fans. While it’s undeniable that some celebrities use their fame for good—advocating for important causes or donating to charities—the culture of idolizing individuals based on superficial attributes often prioritizes entertainment over substance. This phenomenon shifts public attention away from critical issues, such as social injustice or environmental challenges. Furthermore, the idea that celebrities are role models is problematic, as many of them make mistakes like anyone else, yet their actions are magnified, sometimes sending the wrong message. Ultimately, while celebrity culture isn’t inherently bad, its emphasis on fame over integrity and values needs to be reassessed to promote a more balanced and meaningful societal focus. Correction: The concept of celebrity often perpetuates an unhealthy obsession with wealth, beauty, and status, overshadowing more meaningful contributions to society. For example, many celebrities are criticized for their excessive lifestyles, flaunting their privilege while being disconnected from the struggles of everyday people. A glaring issue is the way some celebrities use their platforms irresponsibly, spreading misinformation or promoting harmful trends simply to remain relevant. This behavior not only undermines their influence but can also negatively impact their audience, particularly impressionable young fans. While it’s undeniable that some celebrities use their fame for good—advocating for important causes or donating to charities—the culture of idolizing individuals based on superficial attributes often prioritizes entertainment over substance. This phenomenon shifts public attention away from critical issues, such as social injustice or environmental challenges. Furthermore, the idea that celebrities are role models is problematic, as many of them make mistakes like anyone else, yet their actions are magnified, sometimes sending the wrong message. Ultimately, while celebrity culture isn’t inherently bad, its emphasis on fame over integrity and values needs to be reassessed to promote a more balanced and meaningful societal focus.

Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: A plane can be divided in 4, the fuselage, the wings, the tail and the engine. The fuselage accommodates cargo, passengers and crew members. It also has a specific shape that helps with aerodynamics and acts as the assembly base for the rest of the aircraft. The wings are in charge of keeping the plane flying by generating lift and control the airplanes roll by adjusting flaps. The tail stabilizes and steers the plane (side to side and up and down movement) and helps the aircraft remain stable and controlled. The engine is in charge of providing the sufficient thrust for take off and to propel the air forward while in the air. Without this movement wouldn't be possible. There are different types of engines like jet engines and piston engines which are suitable for different kind of airplanes. Each one of this parts works with the others and is mandatory for the plane to fly. Correction: A plane can be divided in 4, the fuselage, the wings, the tailand the engine. The wings are in charge of keeping the plane flying by generating lift and control the airplanes roll by adjusting flaps. The tail stabilizes and steers the plane (side to side and up and down movement) and helps the aircraft remain stable and controlled. The engine is in charge of providing the sufficient thrust for take off and to propel the air forward while in the air. Without this movement wouldn't be possible. There are different types of engineslike jet engines and piston engineswhich are suitable for different kind of airplanes. Each one of this parts works with the others and is mandatory for the plane to fly.

Before beginning any heavy or hazardous task, a thorough risk assessment should be conducted to identify potential dangers. This helps in developing strategies to mitigate or eliminate risks.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment. NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade. Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries. Correction: The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade pact signed by Canada, Mexico, and the United States, which came into effect on January 1, 1994. NAFTA aimed to eliminate most tariffs and trade barriers between the three countries, creating one of the largest free-trade zones in the world. The agreement was inspired by the success of the European Economic Community and sought to boost economic growth and job creation through increased trade and investment. NAFTA's main provisions included the gradual reduction of tariffs, customs duties, and other trade barriers over a period of up to 15 years. This allowed for duty-free access to a wide range of goods and services, fostering economic integration among the member countries. The agreement also included side agreements on labor and environmental standards to address concerns about the potential negative impacts of increased trade. Despite facing significant opposition and political debates, NAFTA was generally seen as beneficial for the North American economies. It facilitated the flow of goods, services, and capital, contributing to economic growth and higher living standards. However, it also had its critics, who argued that it led to job losses in certain industries exposed to trade competition. In 2020, NAFTA was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA), which aimed to modernize and update the trade relationship between the three countries.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write about buying a home and applying for a home loan in your country. How easy or difficult is the process? Are there a lot of forms to fill out? Is housing expensive? What are the interest rates? Do you need to use a real estate agent or mortgage broker? Type in the input box. Write 200-250 words. Response: Buying a home in India is a major life decision and involves a lengthy and sometimes complex process. First, one must decide on the location and budget. Housing prices vary significantly across the country. In metro cities like Mumbai, Delhi, and Bangalore, real estate is extremely expensive, while smaller cities and towns offer more affordable options. Applying for a home loan requires various documents, including proof of identity, Income, address, and property details. Banks and housing finance companies often request salary slips, bank statements, PAN cards, and employment proof. Though the process has become more streamlined with digital platforms, it can still be time-consuming due to verifications and paperwork. Interest rates in India vary depending on the bank and the applicant's credit profile. As of now, the average home loan interest rate ranges between 8% and 10%. Many people use areal estate agent or broker to find suitable properties and handle negotiations, although it's not mandatory. For loans, some also use mortgage advisors who help compare offers from various lenders. Overall, while the process is manageable with the right guidance, it can feel overwhelming for first-time buyers. However, government schemes like PMAY(Pradhan Mantri Awas Yojana) provides subsidies that help make housing more affordable for middle-and lower-income families. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: The fuselage is the body of the aircraft. The landing gear can be retracted into the undercarriage of the fuselage after take-off and must be in a GEAR DOWN position before landing. All passenger seats are located in the fuselage, as well as the cockpit and cargo storage locations. Attached to the fuselage are the wings. Due to the curved shape of the upper part of the wing it creates lift, but - by increasing the angle of attack and thus increasing lift - also more drag. For take-off and landing the pilot should use the flaps to decrease the stall speed. At the end of each wing you can find the ailerons. These parts are controlled by moving the stick in the cockpit left and right, causing the airplane to roll into the desired direction. Simultaneously using the rudder to support the directional change is key to a nice and clean turn. The rudder is part of the vertical stabilizer at the tail of the aircraft and controls the rate of turn. Another part of the tail is the horizontal stabilizer. This system is used to change the angle of attack and therefore the rate of climb and the altitude of the aircraft. Last but not least it depends on the type of aircraft which engine type is used. Generally, today there are two common types of engines used in aviation: Single engine piston engines, which commonly run on aviation gas (AVGAS), or turbines, which use jet-fuel or kerosene. Correction: The fuselage is the body of the aircraft. The landing gear can be retracted into the undercarriage of the fuselage after take-off and must be in a GEAR DOWN position before landing. All passenger seats are located in the fuselage, as well as the cockpit and cargo storage locations. Attached to the fuselage are the wings. Due to the curved shape of the upper part of the wingit creates lift, but - by increasing the angle of attack and thus increasing lift - also more drag. For take-off and landingthe pilot should use the flaps to decrease the stall speed. At the end of each wingyou can find the ailerons. These parts are controlled by moving the stick in the cockpit left and right, causing the airplane to roll into the desired direction. Simultaneously using the rudder to support the directional change is key to a nice and clean turn. The rudder is part of the vertical stabilizer at the tail of the aircraft and controls the rate of turn. Another part of the tail is the horizontal stabilizer. This system is used to change the angle of attack and therefore the rate of climb and the altitude of the aircraft. Last but not least it depends on the type of aircraft which engine type is used. Generally, today there are two common types of engines used in aviation: Single engine piston engines, which commonly run on aviation gas (AVGAS), or turbines, which use jet-fuel or kerosene.

Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: NAFTA: A Detailed Look at North American Trade The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a groundbreaking accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, officially coming into force in January 1994. The culmination of years of intricate negotiations, NAFTA's primary goal was to dramatically reduce or completely eliminate customs duties among its three member states. This initiative aimed to foster a more integrated and fluid economic environment across North America. NAFTA's impact was far-reaching, profoundly reshaping trade relations, particularly within the agricultural sector. A notable example of this transformation was the significant increase in the flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the US market. Beyond agriculture, the agreement influenced various industries by removing trade barriers, which theoretically made goods and services cheaper and more accessible across borders. While NAFTA generated both positive and negative impacts for each of the participating countries, the general consensus among economists and policymakers is that, overall, it benefited all three members. It spurred economic growth, increased trade volumes, and led to greater specialization in production among the nations. However, it also faced criticism, particularly concerning job displacement in certain sectors and environmental concerns. Despite these debates, NAFTA served as the cornerstone of North American trade policy for over two decades until it was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, marking a new chapter in regional economic cooperation. Would you like to know more about the specific impacts of NAFTA on any of the member countries, or perhaps about the USMCA that replaced it? Correction: NAFTA: A Detailed Look at North American Trade The North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a groundbreaking accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, officially coming into force in January 1994. The culmination of years of intricate negotiations, NAFTA's primary goal was to dramatically reduce or completely eliminate customs duties among its three member states. This initiative aimed to foster a more integrated and fluid economic environment across North America. NAFTA's impact was far-reaching, profoundly reshaping trade relations, particularly within the agricultural sector. A notable example of this transformation was the significant increase in the flow of Mexican fruits and vegetables into the US market. Beyond agriculture, the agreement influenced various industries by removing trade barriers, which theoretically made goods and services cheaper and more accessible across borders. While NAFTA generated both positive and negative impacts for each of the participating countries, the general consensus among economists and policymakers is that, overall, it benefited all three members. It spurred economic growth, increased trade volumes, and led to greater specialization in production among the nations. However, it also faced criticism, particularly concerning job displacement in certain sectors and environmental concerns. Despite these debates, NAFTA served as the cornerstone of North American trade policy for over two decades until it was replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, marking a new chapter in regional economic cooperation. Would you like to know more about the specific impacts of NAFTA on any of the member countries, or perhaps about the USMCA that replaced it?

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: I will write about a famous or infamous celebrity, Salman Khan depending on your perspective of how you see him. He has been a towering figure in Bollywood, epitomizes the paradox of celebrity culture. While his charisma and box-office dominance in films like, 'Dabangg' and 'Bajrangi Bhaijaan' have earned him a massive following, his career is marred by controversies, alleged involvement in hit-and-run cases, poaching scandals, and accusations of promoting toxic masculinity through hyper-macho roles. These incidents highlight a troubling aspect of his persona: a perceived sense of impunity, often shielded by wealth and fame. His fans’ unwavering loyalty, despite such issues, underscores a broader problem with celebrity worship—where charisma overshadows accountability. The concept of celebrity itself is flawed. It elevates individuals to near-mythical status, creating a disconnect from reality. Fans idolize stars like Salman Khan, projecting ideals onto them while ignoring their human failings. This culture fosters superficial values, prioritizing fame and wealth over substance. Celebrities often exploit this adulation, perpetuating a cycle of unchecked power and influence. In a world grappling with real issues, the obsession with celebrity distracts from meaningful discourse, reducing complex individuals to mere spectacles. Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a criticism of a celebrity. It can be a particular celebrity or the whole idea of celebrity in general. Use some of the language you have learned for criticizing in this lesson. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: Being rich and famous is everyone's dream, or at least for many. But is being famous really that appealing? These days, thanks to mass media and the internet, many people quickly go from anonymity to fame. TV shows about royalty, videos posted on YouTube, and social media have made it possible to create celebrities, like cooking popcorn. While some know how to handle this media attention and make the most of it, many also begin to exhibit bizarre behavior, and others experience periods of depression when they realize how empty their lives are behind a gilded facade. Many celebrities, especially athletes, singers, and actors, spend much of their virtual lives—that is, on social media—posting photos of themselves at parties and on lavish vacations, or photos of their luxurious homes or luxury cars. Some seek to link their image to philanthropists who donate money to public causes or people in need. There's no better marketing! Then, they return to their luxurious lives with a purified soul. Unknown heroes like Superman or Spider-Man are only found in comic books. I personally believe that being rich and famous, that is, having immense power, means, above all, having a great responsibility and respect for others, as we owe them. And if we have been blessed with this kind of fortune, we should focus on creating well-being for society and put aside vanity and ostentation. Correction: Being rich and famous is everyone's dream, or at least for many. But is being famous really that appealing? These days, thanks to mass media and the internet, many people quickly go from anonymity to fame. TV shows about royalty, videos posted on YouTube, and social media have made it possible to create celebrities, like cooking popcorn. While some know how to handle this media attention and make the most of it, many also begin to exhibit bizarre behavior, and others experience periods of depression when they realize how empty their lives are behind a gilded facade. Many celebrities, especially athletes, singers, and actors, spend much of their virtual lives—that is, on social media—posting photos of themselves at parties and on lavish vacations, or photos of their luxurious homes or luxury cars. Some seek to link their image to philanthropists who donate money to public causes or people in need. There's no better marketing! Then, they return to their luxurious lives with a purified soul. Unknown heroes like Superman or Spider-Man are only found in comic books. I personally believe that being rich and famous, that is, having immense power, means, above all, having a great responsibility and respect for others, as we owe them. And if we have been blessed with this kind of fortune, we should focus on creating well-being for society and put aside vanity and ostentation.

Prompt Level: 11.0 Prompt: Write a paragraph about how media has changed in your lifetime. What media was important before? What do you use now, and how has it changed your reading habits? Pay attention to your use of commas, colons and semicolons. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Use your own words where possible. Response: Media has experienced a profound transformation over the years, shifting from traditional forms to digital platforms. In the past, newspapers, magazines, and television were the primary sources of information and entertainment; people relied heavily on these mediums for news updates, entertainment, and educational content. However, with the advent of the internet and smartphones, digital media has taken precedence. Social media platforms, online news websites, and streaming services have become integral to daily life. This shift has significantly altered reading habits: instead of waiting for the morning paper, people now access news instantly through apps and websites. The convenience of digital media allows for real-time updates and interactive content, making information more accessible and engaging. Consequently, the way people consume media has become more dynamic and immediate, reflecting the rapid pace of technological advancement. The ability to customize and filter content according to personal preferences has further enhanced the user experience, making digital media a more versatile and powerful tool in the modern age. Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: The main body of an aircraft is known as the fuselage. It typically has a long, narrow, tubular shape designed to minimize air resistance and enhance aerodynamic efficiency. Inside the fuselage is the cabin, where the flight crew and passengers are accommodated throughout the journey. The landing gear is housed in the lower section of the fuselage and can be retracted after takeoff and deployed again during landing. Extending from either side of the fuselage are the wings, which are fundamental to generating lift. They are slightly curved—a design feature known as an airfoil—that allows air to move more quickly over the top surface than the bottom, creating the lift necessary for flight. Attached to the rear edge of the wings are flaps, which are hinged control surfaces. When lowered, flaps increase the curvature and surface area of the wing, enhancing lift during critical phases such as takeoff and landing. The stability of the aircraft is largely maintained by the tail assembly, located at the rear of the plane. The vertical component of the tail is referred to as the vertical stabilizer or fin, which helps maintain directional stability. Attached to it is the rudder, a movable surface that enables the aircraft to yaw, or turn left and right, during flight. Correction: The main body of an aircraft is known as the fuselage. It typically has a long, narrow, tubular shape designed to minimize air resistance and enhance aerodynamic efficiency. Inside the fuselage is the cabin, where the flight crew and passengers are accommodated throughout the journey. The landing gear is housed in the lower section of the fuselage and can be retracted after takeoff and deployed again during landing. Extending from either side of the fuselage are the wings, which are fundamental to generating lift. They are slightly curved—a design feature known as an airfoil—that allows air to move more quickly over the top surface than the bottom, creating the lift necessary for flight. Attached to the rear edge of the wings are flaps, which are hinged control surfaces. When lowered, flaps increase the curvature and surface area of the wing, enhancing lift during critical phases such as takeoff and landing. The stability of the aircraft is largely maintained by the tail assembly, located at the rear of the plane. The vertical component of the tail is referred to as the vertical stabilizer or fin, which helps maintain directional stability. Attached to it is the rudder, a movable surface that enables the aircraft to yaw, or turn left and right, during flight.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Summarize the report, using your own words. Write 8-10 lines. Compare your text with the model. Response: On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293 landed safely in San Francisco with its nose wheels turned sideways. The plane originally took off from Oakland to Phoenix with 141 passengers and no problems at first. The crew saw error messages about the nose landing gear and steering. They flew by the control tower in San Jose, which confirmed the nose wheels were facing the wrong way. The captain chose San Francisco for landing due to its better emergency support and longer runway. To make the landing safer, the crew flew around to burn fuel and reduce weight. Passengers were told about the gear issue and evacuation plans in case of an emergency. The captain landed the plane carefully, avoiding reverse thrust and using normal brakes. Tires tore apart during landing, but the plane stayed straight on the runway. No one was hurt, and passengers exited safely the aircraft using an air stair. Correction: On June 13, 2010, InterStar Airways Flight 293 landed safely in San Francisco with its nose wheels turned sideways. The plane originally took off from Oakland to Phoenix with 141 passengers and no problems at first. The crew saw error messages about the nose landing gear and steering. They flew by the control tower in San Jose, which confirmed the nose wheels were facing the wrong way. The captain chose San Francisco for landing due to its better emergency support and longer runway. To make the landing safer, the crew flew around to burn fuel and reduce weight. Passengers were told about the gear issue and evacuation plans in case of an emergency. The captain landed the plane carefully, avoiding reverse thrust and using normal brakes. Tires tore apart during landing, but the plane stayed straight on the runway. No one was hurt, and passengers exited safely the aircraft using an air stair.

Prompt Level: 7.0 Prompt: Your teacher has asked you to write a short text about the parts of an airplane. Explain what each of the different parts are for, including the fuselage, wings, tail and engines. Write 150-200 words. Response: An airplane is a complex machine composed of several essential components, each playing a crucial role in ensuring its functionality and ability to fly. At the core is the fuselage, the main body of the aircraft, which houses the cockpit, passenger cabin, and cargo space. The cockpit contains the controls and navigation systems, enabling pilots to operate the airplane. The fuselage's structure is designed to withstand pressure differences during flight, ensuring passenger safety and comfort. The wings are perhaps the most critical elements for flight. Their aerodynamic shape creates lift by generating lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure underneath. Flaps and ailerons on the wings further enhance control during takeoff, landing, and turns. The tail assembly, also known as the empennage, provides stability. It includes the vertical stabilizer, which prevents side-to-side motion, and the horizontal stabilizer, which manages pitch control. Finally, engines, whether jet or propeller-based, generate the thrust necessary for forward motion. Together, these parts harmonize to enable safe and efficient air travel. Correction: An airplane is a complex machine composed of several essential components, each playing a crucial role in ensuring its functionality and ability to fly. At the core is the fuselage, the main body of the aircraft, which houses the cockpit, passenger cabin, and cargo space. The cockpit contains the controls and navigation systems, enabling pilots to operate the airplane. The fuselage's structure is designed to withstand pressure differences during flight, ensuring passenger safety and comfort. The wings are perhaps the most critical elements for flight. Their aerodynamic shape creates lift by generating lower pressure on the upper surface and higher pressure underneath. Flaps and ailerons on the wings further enhance control during takeoff, landing, and turns. The tail assembly, also known as the empennage, provides stability. It includes the vertical stabilizer, which prevents side-to-side motion, and the horizontal stabilizer, which manages pitch control. Finally, engines, whether jet or propeller-based, generate the thrust necessary for forward motion. Together, these parts harmonize to enable safe and efficient air travel.

I’ve gone through the risk assessment for your secondhand clothes shop, and based on the checklist, here are a few changes you can make to help lower your property and liability insurance premiums.

Building Condition: Since the building is old, it might be increasing your premiums. Consider investing in some basic repairs, especially for plumbing and electrical systems. Insurance companies often view buildings with outdated infrastructure as higher risks.

Security: Installing security systems like an alarm, CCTV, and better locks will lower the risk of theft and vandalism. Many insurers offer discounts for properties with enhanced security measures.

Fire Safety: Adding fire extinguishers, smoke detectors, and possibly sprinklers could help reduce the risk of fire-related claims. These improvements may also make your insurance premiums more manageable.

Liability Coverage: Since the building is older, consider limiting your liability coverage to match the size and layout of the premises. If possible, raise your deductible to reduce premiums.

Let me know if you need help coordinating any of these changes!

In conclusion, CSR isn’t just a “nice-to-have” anymore—it’s essential for businesses to remain relevant, ethical, and sustainable in a world that increasingly values social responsibility. Prompt Level: 13.0 Prompt: Use the information in the notes to write an informative text about NAFTA, or write about a trade agreement your country is a part of. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: he North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, which came into effect in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its primary goal was to eliminate or significantly reduce customs duties and trade barriers among the three member countries, thereby promoting free trade and economic integration across North America. NAFTA had a profound impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture. For example, it facilitated the large-scale export of Mexican fruits and vegetables to the U.S., enhancing food availability and lowering prices. The agreement also encouraged cross-border investments and the development of integrated supply chains, especially in manufacturing and automotive industries. However, NAFTA’s effects were not uniformly positive. While it boosted overall trade and economic growth, it also led to job displacements in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing sectors in the U.S. and Canada. In Mexico, small-scale farmers faced increased competition from subsidized U.S. agricultural products. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is widely regarded as beneficial to all three countries, laying the foundation for deeper economic cooperation. It was eventually replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, which updated and modernized many of its provisions. Correction: he North American Free Trade Agreement (NAFTA) was a landmark trade accord between the United States, Canada, and Mexico, which came into effect in January 1994 after years of negotiation. Its primary goal was to eliminate or significantly reduce customs duties and trade barriers among the three member countries, thereby promoting free trade and economic integration across North America. NAFTA had a profound impact on trade relations, particularly in sectors like agriculture. For example, it facilitated the large-scale export of Mexican fruits and vegetables to the U.S., enhancing food availability and lowering prices. The agreement also encouraged cross-border investments and the development of integrated supply chains, especially in manufacturing and automotive industries. However, NAFTA’s effects were not uniformly positive. While it boosted overall trade and economic growth, it also led to job displacements in certain industries, particularly in manufacturing sectors in the U.S. and Canada. In Mexico, small-scale farmers faced increased competition from subsidized U.S. agricultural products. Despite these challenges, NAFTA is widely regarded as beneficial to all three countries, laying the foundation for deeper economic cooperation. It was eventually replaced by the United States-Mexico-Canada Agreement (USMCA) in 2020, which updated and modernized many of its provisions.

Prompt Level: 16.0 Prompt: Write a description of a legendary creature that’s popular in your country, or one you find interesting. Type in the input box. Write 150-200 words. Response: In the heart of Indian folklore lies the Naga, a legendary serpent-being revered and feared across the subcontinent. Half-human and half-cobra, Nagas are believed to dwell in deep underground realms, especially beneath rivers, lakes, and sacred mountains. These beings appear throughout Hindu and Buddhist traditions, often as guardians of treasure, nature, or ancient wisdom. In Hindu mythology, Nagas are descendants of Kashyapa and Kadru and are led by the mighty serpent king Shesha, who coils beneath Lord Vishnu as a divine bed. Another famous Naga, Vasuki, was used as a rope during the churning of the ocean (Samudra Manthan), a pivotal cosmic event. Nagas are both benevolent and wrathful. They are known to bless those who honor them, yet bring drought or misfortune to those who offend them or desecrate their abodes. In parts of India, particularly in Kerala and Assam, Nagas are worshipped with great reverence, with entire festivals like Nag Panchami dedicated to them. More than mere myth, the Naga embodies India's deep respect for the natural world and the mysteries that lie beneath the surface, reminding all of the ancient forces still believed to shape the land and its destiny. Half-human and half-cobra, Nagas are believed to dwell in deep underground realms, especially beneath rivers, lakes, and sacred mountains. These beings appear throughout Hindu and Buddhist traditions, often as guardians of treasure, nature, or ancient wisdom. In Hindu mythology, Nagas are descendants of Kashyapa and Kadru and are led by the mighty serpent king Shesha, who coils beneath Lord Vishnu as a divine bed. Another famous Naga, Vasuki, was used as a rope during the churning of the ocean (Samudra Manthan), a pivotal cosmic event. Nagas are both benevolent and wrathful. They are known to bless those who honor them, yet bring drought or misfortune to those who offend them or desecrate their abodes. In parts of India, particularly in Kerala and Assam, Nagas are worshipped with great reverence, with entire festivals like Nag Panchami dedicated to them.
